title: A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a ﬂexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields?	Biology	Biomedical Engineering	Chemistry	Chemical Engineering	Computer Engineering	Computer Science	Design	Electrical Engineering	Mechanical Engineering	Physics 	If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America’s Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on October 24 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.

title: Expanding your market: Copyright protection - RESCHEDULED
Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

title: 2024 National Patent Application Drafting Competition overview webinar
description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) invites law students studying patent law to participate in the 2024 National Patent Application Drafting Competition. The competition introduces students to issues arising in U.S. patent law and develops their patent application drafting, amending, and prosecution skills.

title: Strategies for protecting and enforcing intellectual property regarding China: What Green Bay and Wisconsin businesses need to know
description: Green Bay-area and Wisconsin enterprises doing business in or with China may find their valuable intellectual property (IP) is being infringed upon. Even businesses not operating in China may find counterfeit versions of their products for sale in China or the United States, or their trademarks registered in China without their knowledge. Join us for this free, one-day in-person program where experts from the U.S. Government, IP attorneys, and local business people will share insights on how U.S. rights holders can protect and enforce their IP in China and the United States.

title: Empowering Innovations: Celebrating Hispanic pioneers in education and invention
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Office of Education on October 31, 6-7:30 p.m. ET for an illuminating Fireside Chat on Innovation from the Hispanic community. Tune in to this webinar as we delve deep into the intricate dance of innovation, invention, and mentorship.

Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office’s (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. Watch the public session virtually on Webex (TBD). The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled public meeting.

Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.

title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
Coming to New Orleans November 17: Women's entrepreneurship
One-day trademarks boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 18, 2023 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT with Build Bronzeville SBDC at Quad Communities Development Corporation (QCDC) in Chicago, Illinois. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.
